name: my crochet kitchen: munchkin pumpkin
notes:
growing pumpkins is one of my highlights of the summer – and
harvesting them in autumn is even better!

these little munchkins are such a cute variety and are perfect for decorating the house (before making their way to the oven).

this is a beginner-friendly pattern that’s quick as well as easy to make.

it’s worked in continuous rounds, shaped and then the stem is crocheted separately before attaching.

you’ll also find a stitch guide included to help you with the particular stitches used throughout this pattern, and to grow your amigurumi skills!

you could try making multiple pumpkins in a range of different autumnal shades, or add some natural variation to the height by adding a few rounds of xs all round.
